text.p: Honda Motor Co Ltd said on Monday that its domestic vehicle production, exports, domestic sales and overseas output in calendar 1996 were as follows (with percentage comparisons from a year ago):
Honda's domestic output rose in 1996, the first gain in six years, mainly due to higher domestic sales and an increase in exports of Civics to North America, a Honda spokesman said.
Domestic sales rose for the second straight year, due to robust demand for Odyssey and Step Wagon recreational vehicles, surpassing the previous record of 686,560 cars in 1990.

Exports fell for the sixth straight year, reflecting higher production abroad. Exports fell despite the resumption of Civic sedan exports to the United States in August, and the start of CR-V light sport-utility vehicle exports to the United States in December.
Overseas production rose for the third successive year due to higher output in North America and Asia.
Honda's domestic vehicle production, exports, domestic sales and overseas output for December were as follows:
